summary: This is an email chain from June 2019 discussing scheduling a meeting to talk about the plan for the Epstein case. It involves personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), including the Chief of the Criminal Division.

persons.name: Janis
persons.role: Supervisor or colleague at US Attorney's Office
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who confirmed that Jenn Ranucci is the new supervisor. The email author raised an issue with Janis.

persons.name: Jenn Ranucci
persons.role: New supervisor at US Attorney's Office
persons.context: Identified as the new supervisor with whom the email author has a relationship and plans to meet regarding the Epstein matter.

persons.name: Russell
persons.role: Colleague or participant in the Epstein case
persons.context: A person the Chief of the Criminal Division wants to include in a meeting to discuss the plan for the Epstein case.

connections.description: Janis confirmed to the email author that Jenn Ranucci is the new supervisor.

events.title: Meeting request for Epstein case plan
events.description: The Chief of the Criminal Division requests a meeting with a colleague and Russell to discuss the plan for the Epstein case.

events.title: Scheduling discussion for Epstein matter
events.description: Email correspondence discusses waiting until the following Thursday and arranging a meeting with the new supervisor, Jenn Ranucci, regarding the Epstein matter.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain from June 2019 among personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
It discusses scheduling a meeting to talk about 'the plan for the Epstein case,' indicating active case management at that time.
It references a personnel change, noting Jenn Ranucci as the 'new supervisor' for the matter.
One participant was in El Salvador but returning, showing international travel during the case planning.
